body_html:
I suffered "ImportError: DLL load failed: The specified module could not be found." like what Audrius-St got. I also tried os.environ as peterjc123 suggested, but had no luck.

By comparing site-package/torch of the conda version and wheel version, I found that there are some cuda related dll files in site-packages/torch/lib only appearing with conda version. Then I tried copied all my cuda and nvtoolsext dll files to that folder in the conda environment I created for the wheel version, which worked perfectly. I guess the same logic should work for other projects with external dll reference as well.

I believe that not all the dll files I copied are useful, and it should be possible to figure out those used in the compilation by reading peterjc123's CI output.

Not sure if this could be helpful to others.

body:
I suffered "ImportError: DLL load failed: The specified module could not be found." like what Audrius-St got. I also tried os.environ as peterjc123 suggested, but had no luck.

By comparing site-package/torch of the conda version and wheel version,  I found that there are some cuda related dll files in site-packages/torch/lib only appearing with conda version. Then I tried copied all my cuda and nvtoolsext dll files to that folder in the conda environment I created for the wheel version, which worked perfectly. I guess the same logic should work for other projects with external dll reference as well.

I believe that not all the dll files I copied are useful, and it should be possible to figure out those used in the compilation by reading peterjc123's CI output.

Not sure if this could be helpful to others.
